abstract: Jenny Rosenstrach reviews cookbooks It's All Easy: Delicious Weekday Recipes for the Super-Busy Home Cook by Gwyneth Paltrow, The Love & Lemons Cookbook: An Apple-to-Zucchini Celebration of Impromptu Cooking by Jeanine Donofrio, The Vegetable Butcher by Cara Mangini, Vegan, Vegetarian, Omnivore by Anna Thomas, Flavorwalla by Floyd Cardoz, The Nordic Kitchen: One Year of Family Cooking by Claus Meyer, Koreatown by Deuki Hong and Matt Rodbard, Cook Korean!: A Comic Book With Recipes by Robin Ha and Tasting Rome by Katie Parla and Kristina Gill.
lead_paragraph: Interest in vegetable cookery continues strong, with foreign flavors from Norway, Korea and Italy adding spice.

headline.main: Cooking: Gwyneth Paltrow’s ‘It’s All Easy,’ and More

snippet: Interest in vegetable cookery continues strong, with foreign flavors from Norway, Korea and Italy adding spice.
